name: COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, Appellant, v. Jose Manuel AVILES, Appellee

judges: Justice EAKIN did not participate in the consideration or decision of this case.
parties: COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, Appellant, v. Jose Manuel AVILES, Appellee.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM.
AND NOW, this 21st day of June, 2004, the order of the Lancaster County Court of Common Pleas is reversed insofar as it declared the Registration of Sexual Offenders Act unconstitutional, and the case is remanded for further proceedings. See Commonwealth v. Williams, 574 Pa. 487, 832 A.2d 962 (2003); Commonwealth v. Maldonado, 576 Pa. 101, 838 A.2d 710 (2003).
Justice EAKIN did not participate in the consideration or decision of this case.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM.

attorneys: Janna Rae Steinruck, for Commonwealth of Pennsylvania.
James Arthur Gratton, Esq., James Jude Karl, Esq., Lancaster, for Jose Manuel Aviles.
casebody.head_matter:
851 A.2d 852
COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, Appellant, v. Jose Manuel AVILES, Appellee.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Submitted Nov. 10, 2003.
Decided June 21, 2004.
Janna Rae Steinruck, for Commonwealth of Pennsylvania.
James Arthur Gratton, Esq., James Jude Karl, Esq., Lancaster, for Jose Manuel Aviles.
